Name: 13 Steps
Definition: Doneness criteria from Fidelity case study.

Name: Above and Beyond
Definition: great work - more than anyone expected

Name: Accountability
Definition: Responsible for completing or overseeing the completion of a certain task, activity or project.  Same as

Name: Action Step
Definition: the result of a specific post-RIP session designed to draw them out

Name: ADL
Note: Responsible for all project work for all brands, account P&L, budgets and quality of deliverables.

Name: APICS
Definition: American Production and Inventory Control Society

Name: Architect
Definition: Responsible for the system architecture and the technical design.

Name: ATL
Note: Below the line (advertising) - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Name: B / O
Definition: Breakout:  Part of the workshops where the team breaks into smaller teams to work on specific objectives to be accomplished.

Name: Backoffice / Legacy systems
Definition: software systems that the client uses at their site currently which the software / website we are developing for them will / may need to interact with

Name: BAM
Note: Responsible for undesrstand- ing any third party asset needs (photos, videos)

Name: Bandwidth
Definition: The data transfer rate of an electronic communications system.  In Sapient terms, the amount of capacity that an individual or team has to carry out a project / task.

Name: Barco
Definition: Presentation monitor (big TV-like monitor) in each DC (usually 2 per DC), used to show powerpoint presentations to the team and clients.  History:  The first monitors were from the

Name: Baseline
Definition: Baseline is a logical snapshot of one or more related work products at a given point of time

Name: Bootcamp and Field Training
Definition: The previous generation name for Sapient Start

Name: Boxlight
Definition: a portable projector unit that can be hooked up to a laptop

Name: Branding
Definition: Every point of contact with a customer is consistent; a common voice

Name: Brief
Definition: Definition of what the client biz wants to achive

Name: Browser
Definition: A software program that enables you to view pages of text and graphics on the Web.

Name: Buy-in
Definition: Agreement to move forward on a given subject / project.  Similar terms used:

Name: C-level
Definition: Senior corporate executives - CEOs, COOs, CFOs etc.

Name: CC
Definition: Configuration Controller (CC) is a key role played part time or full time (depending on the size of the project) to maintain the integrity of the Configuration Management process on the project

Name: CCB
Definition: Change Control Board (CCB) is a group designated on a project to approve Change Requests (CRs) for Configuration Items and for Scope Changes

Name: CDM
Note: Responsible for the brand P&L, budget, and overall delivery.

Name: Checkpoint
Definition: Checking in with the team after a breakout session.

Name: CI
Definition: Configuration Item (CI) is a key work product that will be managed and controlled during the project. Project Plan, Scope Matrix, Design Documents, Test Plans and Code are all examples of CIs.

Name: closure activity
Definition: Either conducting a formal internal debrief or completing a formal project case study OR Archiving all relevant project artefacts in ResultSpace

Name: Cluster
Definition: Network of confusion / something screwed up.

Name: CM
Definition: configuration mgt: helps a project maintain its documents and software in a controlled and consistent manner. Key elements of the process include using a version control tool with a well-defined directory structure and employing a change request and approval process for important project artefacts

Name: CMM
Definition: Capability Maturity Model: assess the effectiveness of a software development processes on a scale from 1 (utter chaos) to 5 (continuously improving). (...) developed by the Software Engineering Institute (SEI). (...) Today many U.S. government agencies in addition to the DoD insist that companies that bid for their business obtain at least a CMM Level 3 assessmentâ€”meaning the development organization has a codified, repeatable process for an entire division or company. see http: / /www.cio.com / archive / 030104 / cmm.html

Name: Coffee Boy
Definition: When you have been on a team long enough and you are sick of introducing yourself to new team members and clients, so instead of giving your role as engineer or architect, you become the

Name: Core Values
Definition: The five values, which guide our actions and decisions: Delivery, Creativity, People Growth, Openness, Leadership, and Relationships.

Name: CT
Note: Responsible for producing design system inline with requirments outlined in project brief, and scope matrix.

Name: DAT
Definition: Deal Assistance Team / Deal Administration Team

Name: Dependencies
Definition: In planning and risk management, a relationship among task and activities, where one task or activities must take place before another can occur.

Name: Disney Effect
Definition: The time between a breakout and checkpoint during a workshop when the team is running around pulling everything together and is completely transparent and seamless to the client (e.g., getting the presentations up and ready on the barcos, prepping the client presenter, Visio  overheads ready to go)

Name: DL
Definition: Delivery Lead, or in Microsoft Outlook email - 'Distribution list'

Name: Do what makes sense
Definition: The one guideline which trumps all other rules

Name: Drive to closure
Definition: Attempt to get a commitment, or next steps, or agreement on a particular subject so that it is

Name: Drive-by (or fly-by)
Definition: To walk from breakout to breakout to review material on whiteboards (used during workshops, design and checkpoints, etc.).

Name: DSC
Definition: Digital Supply Chain (may hear this term used within the manufacturing vertical).

Name: Estimation Tool
Definition: A tool used to predict chance of completion of a tool in a given amount of time

Name: ETC
Definition: Estimate To Complete: Actual effort expended and the Estimate To Complete (ETC) each story step must be captured daily.  Actual and ETC data must be tracked in hours with the smallest increment being 0.5 hours.

Name: Exit Criteria
Definition: Items / tasks that you need to accomplish before moving on to the next phase or task.

Name: Extranet
Definition: A secured website in which you need a password and have to be authenticated to gain access.

Name: Facilitator
Definition: Responsible for facilitating a RIP or workshop.

Name: Fancy Pants
Definition: a term coined on the mcsys, first health teams for

Name: feature
Definition: a service that the system provides to fulfil one or more stakeholder needs

Name: Feedback
Definition: The cornerstone of Openness at Sapient.  Sharing your impressions of anything is highly valued and will constantly be solicited.

Name: fishbowl
Definition: a conference room with glass windows

Name: FVS
Definition: Functional Verification Scripts (end to end scenario script to verify the finality)

Name: growth opportunity
Definition: a task given to someone who has not done it before, when delivered with a sarcastic tone it often implies that the task is less than desirable

Name: Halsey
Definition: T. Squares - to draw lines easily

Name: ICE
Definition: Innovate, Communicate and Educate - internal team

Name: Inputs
Definition: Information fed into a data processing system or computer.  Also used as information that is fed into the beginning of a new phase or start of a project.

Name: Internet
Definition: An electronic communications network that connects computer networks and organizational computer facilities around the world.

Name: Intranet
Definition: A company's internal website.  You have to have access to the LAN and / or WAN (behind the

Name: iPM
Note: Responsible for managing brand specific project(s).

Name: ISP
Definition: Internet Service Provider - an organization which provides access to the Internet and / or additional services.

Name: Iteration
Definition: Process where we continually revisit and review work, decisions, and solutions to ensure accuracy and effectiveness.

Name: kill
Definition: how candidates not receiving offers are referred to

Name: leverage
Definition: using your strengths to gain an advantage

Name: Links
Definition: Connections from one page to another.  You can find a link on a web page by looking for one or more words highlighted with color, underlining or both.  Images and icons also can be links.

Name: llama
Definition: a person who has done something dumb

Name: LLP
Definition: Acronym for Low Level Plan. Every Sapient team member maintains a low level plan which lists their target tasks in a rolling two week window. This practice makes every team member proactive in scheduling meetings ahead of time and allows them to move future tasks up when a current task is delayed. In this way, no one is ever sitting around waiting for anyone or anything, because there is always a two week long list of things you could be working on. This tool is used by team members to estimate their tracking to this plan against the MLP, where they are either X days ahead or X days behind or 'OnTrack'. The LLP is also updated as part of the Microschedule? step in the Steps of Completion or Doneness.

Name: Newbies
Definition: New hires at Sapient.  Varies how long term is applied but generally not beyond 6-months.

Name: Next Steps
Definition: The action items that need to happen next in order to accomplish an objective.

Name: offsite
Definition: a meeting either outside the office (or at a Sapient site) for a group of employees to discuss their role, plans for the future etc.

Name: OLA
Definition: Online Advertising, also known as banner ads / display ads

Name: Old-bies
Definition: follows from newbies, but those who have been around longer

Name: On the Bench
Definition: Time when you are not assigned to a project or between projects.

Name: One Team
Definition: an approach to selling, resourcing and executing complex multi-disciplinary projects

Name: Outputs
Definition: The information produced by a computer.  Also, information produced at the end of a phase or end of a project.

Name: Owner
Definition: Someone who is responsible for a given task or project, not to be confused as meaning the person that does all the work.

Name: Owner Scope
Definition: The combined size, duration, and sometimes intensity of a project. Usually used to define what's

Name: PC Recorder
Definition: Captures information on the PC using powerpoint, visio, tracker, word and excel that is written on the whiteboard.

Name: pebkac
Definition: problem exists between keyboard and chair.  Most often used as a resolution to production issues discovered by clients

Name: pedestal
Definition: mobile filing cabinet to hold a Sapient employee's belongings, often seen being pushed down hallways in mass

Name: phases
Definition: Proposal, Fusion, Design, Implementation, or REAP

Name: PM
Definition: Project Manager - responsible for the whole project

Name: POC
Definition: Point of Contact | Proof of Concept

Name: Position Statement
Definition: Includes Audience, Category, Value Proposition, Differentiation, and Proof Points.

Name: Price the Scope
Definition: Find the estimate and price for a defined scope

Name: Profit
Definition: = SAM $ = Sold as Margin in USD

Name: Program Management
Definition: aka Engagement Leadership: focuses on the high-level leadership and account management skills required to engage strategically and tactically with our clients at the executive level

Name: project
Definition:
any client engagement or sales pursuit that meets all of the following criteria:
â€¢ Services revenue is USD $50,000 or more -Duration is three weeks or longer -Team size is three or more people

Name: PUP
Definition: Process Usage Plan: defines the S|A processes that will be followed by the team

Name: Push Back
Definition: Speak up. Let people know if you disagree, or if you are not able to accept something they are suggesting or asking of you. Pushing back is especially effective and helpful if it happens early on.

Name: Pyramid
Definition: Database that stores information about each employee in regards to their skills, experience, preferences and basic information (role, phone number, etc.).  It is used during resource meetings to staff projects.

Name: Quality Plan
Definition: outlines all types of reviews that will be conducted during the phase

Name: Quickstart
Definition: Quick ramp-up of workshop (e.g., business / industry context, facilitation skills, any other skills required for project)

Name: R
Definition: Relationship Owner, Business Development who owns client relation

Name: RACI
Definition: responsible, accountative, consultative, informative - refers to the level of communication necessary with an employee to get tasks accomplished

Name: Ramp up
Definition: The process of becoming well-versed in any given project or technology.

Name: RASIC
Note: MSL specific (See also RACI in ALL)

Name: RDL
Note: Responsible for all project work for all brands, account P&L, budgets and quality of deliverables.

Name: release
Definition: a formal delivery of some or all of the solution to production or the client QA environment; Releases to production or the client QA environment must occur no less frequently than every four months

Name: RFI
Definition: Request for Information - Request to understand our capabilities to do a type of work

Name: RFP
Definition: Request for Proposal - What a client wants a vendor to do

Name: roll on / roll off
Definition: to start or finish a role or project

Name: SA 3
Definition: Sapient Approach 3 - The official Sapient Methodology

Name: SCM
Definition: Software Configuration Management relates to formally defining the artifacts to be managed and controlled on a project and maintaining consistent baselines through version control for these artifacts.

Name: Scope
Definition: Estimating the size of a project from 3 angles:  BREADTH - what's the functionality, how broad; DEPTH - level of complexity; RESOURCES - money, time, materials, people

Name: scope
Definition: contractual scope is captured in the scope matrix referenced by the Statement of Work

Name: Scope the Price
Definition: Find the scope that can be delivered (with value) for the price

Name: seeded / seeding
Definition: when an individual from one discipline acts as a bridge to another discipline

Name: SEPG
Definition: Software Engineering Process Group is the centralized group responsible for CMM vision and direction, overall process architecture, and evolution of processes. The closest equivalent at Sapient prior to our CMM initiative has been the Sapient|Approach team.

Name: SIG
Definition: Strategy and Innovation Group.  SIG is also used as the acronym for Special Interest Group.  There are special interest groups (SIG's) within the Oracle Applications User Group (OAUG).  For example, there is a Government SIG.  Sometimes SIG's represent vertical markets but not always.

Name: Snake in the grass session
Definition: session to work out frustrations or kinks

Name: SQA
Definition: The Software Quality Assurance (SQA) is a group of auditors / coaches dedicated to ensuring process compliance throughout the BU. They are a distributed group responsible for facilitating and then measuring adoption and process compliance on a regular basis.

Name: Stakeholder Need
Definition: the highest level of requirements that describe what the application should do to help improve or lower the cost of a business process, increase revenue, or meet regulatory or other obligations

Name: Stand Up
Definition: a meeting where all members are standing (usually held first thing in the morning)

Name: STAR a.k.a RATS
Definition: The previous generation prior to pyramid for sapient staffing and resource planning

Name: Step up
Definition: To volunteer and take ownership of a task.

Name: steps of doneness
Definition: This is the list of steps shown across the top of the Doneness Matrix and also the the list of steps used for estimation metrics. Steps of Doneness are often tailored to meet a specific track or class of deliverables

Name: storming
Definition: getting all nerf weapons and attacking

Name: story
Definition: the basic construct used to estimate and define work and must represent something visible and valuable to the client

Name: Straw man
Definition: Rough draft or first pass. Variations: the PC version

Name: SWAMI
Definition: Those mobile white boards that are on sheets.  History: this tool was introduced to us by a client named Swamirama(?), and they are called swamis in his honor.

Name: take this offline
Definition: discussing something informally - used when a group discussion may be better suited to a smaller number of people

Name: TAR
Definition: Technical Assistance Request: is created when a system is not working in a way consistent with specifications. Each TAR is entered into a TAR tracking tool that manages the lifecycle of that TAR as it is tracked closure. Each TAR is categorized (defects, issues, feature enhancements, etc.) and prioritised (P1 through P4) and collaboratively managed by Sapient and the client. Metrics are collected and analysed over the course of the project in order guide decisions around testing, quality, and project closure.

Name: Team Cheer
Definition: What Sapient teams shout at the top of their lungs at the end of the morning meeting. This worked better in our own offices, but when we started working at Client Sites, it was viewed as mildly disruptive

Name: the disney effect
Definition: the added showmanship that is added to everything we do for clients

Name: The good the bad and the ugly
Definition: A way to give the highlights of a project or other task or event.

Name: to
Definition: to record on the whiteboard or in a computer (usually meaning to take what is on a white board and put it into word, excel, ppt etc.)

Name: to
Definition: to write something on a whiteboard

Name: Tracker Software
Definition: a database-based system used to capture standard project items such as issues, TARs, defects, etc

Name: TTL
Note: Below the line (advertising) - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Name: Up to Speed
Definition: Attaining a good working knowledge of a project or technology. Example: after my first week on X project, I was up to speed on the business problem.

Name: war room
Definition: fairly standard consulting term, used as a central place for project planning, project plan presentation, team / project metrics, team meetings, etc.

Name: Waterfall Method
Definition: A development method whereby each step is completed before the next has begun.  For example, requirement gathering / analysis is completed and then design begins.  Often an entirely new group is brought in for each phase in the process.  The waterfall analogy comes from the image that each step is a box.  The boxes fill up and then flow into the next box.  Each step must be complete or filled up in order to move to the next, and no water can move upstream or backward through the process -thus no iteration.

Name: WBL Board
Definition: A place in the team area where each team member writes one or two WBL goals and updates their WBL status weekly. Some people find it easier to make time to have a well balanced life if every one on the team is also focused on the same goal and every one is encouraging each other to do the same.

Name: x wide (usually 2 or 3)
Definition: referring to the number of breakouts needed for a workshop

Name: EYP
Definition: Enabling Your Potential, the replacement to PPG
